overview_summary: All five profiled neighbors have no clear public stance on local development, with none documented as openly supporting or opposing recent projects. Most appear to be private landowners or farmers with no official roles. Only two hold multiple parcels or longstanding family land, but high-influence figures are not evident among these neighbors.

neighbors.name: Ronald F. Hotaling
neighbors.claims: Ronald F. Hotaling owns a home on Adams Road in rural Coxsackie, with a 3-bedroom house and roughly 13 acres of surrounding land ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/Adams-Rd-Coxsackie-NY-12051/450489487_zpid/#:~:text=,NY%2012051Sold)) ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/Adams-Rd-Coxsackie-NY-12051/450489487_zpid/#:~:text=,NY%2012051Off%20Market)). A person named Bambi Hotaling serves as the Coxsackie Town Clerk, indicating the Hotaling family’s local presence ([coxsackie.org](https://coxsackie.org/minutes/#:~:text=PRESENT%3ARichard%20Hanse%2C%20Supervisor%20Thomas%20Burke%2C,Bambi%20Hotaling%2C%20Town%20Clerk%20GUESTS)). However, Ronald Hotaling himself is not recorded in any public meetings or media reports about development issues in the town ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/opinion/article/Letter-Discussions-key-to-successful-siting-15132989.php#:~:text=The%20Feb,to%20set%20the%20record%20straight)) ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Supporter-and-foes-of-Greene-County-solar-farm-15606947.php#:~:text=match%20at%20L119%20%E2%80%9CMy%20family,in%20the%20area%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20said)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected local farming figure or family friend initiate a conversation, emphasizing respect for his family’s land and legacy while explaining how the project addresses farmland preservation.

neighbors.name: Dawn M. Smith
neighbors.claims: Dawn M. Smith is identified as an owner of a neighboring parcel (71.00-3-37) in Greene County records, but little else is publicly available about her background. She does not appear in local news articles or town meeting minutes related to development or land use debates ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Supporter-and-foes-of-Greene-County-solar-farm-15606947.php#:~:text=match%20at%20L119%20%E2%80%9CMy%20family,in%20the%20area%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20said)). No civic roles or public statements by Smith regarding community projects could be found in the public domain ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Supporter-and-foes-of-Greene-County-solar-farm-15606947.php#:~:text=match%20at%20L119%20%E2%80%9CMy%20family,in%20the%20area%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20said)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out with a personal, neighborly approach. Emphasize measures to protect property values and maintain the quiet rural character, addressing any concerns she may have about disturbances.

neighbors.name: Max K. Rausch
neighbors.claims: Max K. Rausch is listed as a landowner of parcel 71.00-3-50, making him an adjacent neighbor, but there is no public information about his occupation or community involvement. He has not been mentioned in any local media coverage or public hearing records concerning development proposals ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Supporter-and-foes-of-Greene-County-solar-farm-15606947.php#:~:text=match%20at%20L119%20%E2%80%9CMy%20family,in%20the%20area%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20said)). Rausch does not hold any known official position in the township and has kept a low profile in community affairs ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Supporter-and-foes-of-Greene-County-solar-farm-15606947.php#:~:text=match%20at%20L119%20%E2%80%9CMy%20family,in%20the%20area%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20said)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Rausch in one-on-one conversation to learn his perspective. Reassure him about visual screening and maintaining the scenery, and explain steps being taken to prevent any decline in nearby property values.

neighbors.name: Beth Ann Clark
neighbors.claims: Beth Ann Clark owns parcel 71.00-3-28 in the area; aside from ownership records, she has no public profile in local civic matters. Clark’s name does not appear in town board minutes or local press reports on recent development controversies ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Supporter-and-foes-of-Greene-County-solar-farm-15606947.php#:~:text=match%20at%20L119%20%E2%80%9CMy%20family,in%20the%20area%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20said)). There is no indication of her holding any leadership roles or making public comments regarding community or land use issues ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Supporter-and-foes-of-Greene-County-solar-farm-15606947.php#:~:text=match%20at%20L119%20%E2%80%9CMy%20family,in%20the%20area%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20said)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a low-key, respectful conversation. Highlight how the project will preserve the peace and quiet of the area and outline plans in place to safeguard property values and personal privacy for nearby residents.

neighbors.name: Thomas Fitzpatrick
neighbors.claims: Thomas Fitzpatrick is a local landowner with multiple adjacent parcels (including 71.00-3-2 and 71.00-2-44), suggesting a larger property holding in the neighborhood ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/Adams-Rd-Coxsackie-NY-12051/450489487_zpid/#:~:text=match%20at%20L176%20%2A%20%2452%2C100,Rd%2C%20Coxsackie%2C%20NY%2012051Off%20Market)). County property listings show one of his parcels has a substantial 7,200 sq ft structure valued around $181,800, indicative of possible farm buildings on site ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/Adams-Rd-Coxsackie-NY-12051/450489487_zpid/#:~:text=match%20at%20L180%20%2A%20%2415%2C800,Rd%2C%20Coxsackie%2C%20NY%2012051Off%20Market)). Fitzpatrick has not been publicly quoted or noted in any forums relating to development disputes or clean energy projects in Greene County ([www.timesunion.com](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Supporter-and-foes-of-Greene-County-solar-farm-15606947.php#:~:text=match%20at%20L119%20%E2%80%9CMy%20family,in%20the%20area%2C%E2%80%9D%20he%20said)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a community leader familiar with farming reach out to Fitzpatrick. Emphasize how the project will respect agricultural land and involve local input, addressing any worries about losing farmland or control over land use decisions.
